name: infectiously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that affects everyone who is present and makes them want to join in, or makes them feel the same way: I felt better after spending an evening with my infectiously cheerful housemates. The girl grinned infectiously and I smiled back at her. The toddler laughed infectiously when she saw the horse walk into the house.
in a way that passes a disease from one person, animal, or plant to another: The army doctors will not let an infectiously sick person return to active duty. The virus can be transmitted infectiously.
More examplesFewer examplesShe is famous for writing infectiously catchy tunes.He is a down-to-earth character with an infectiously positive attitude.Whenever the subject turns to wine, Paulo becomes infectiously enthusiastic.
